result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael J. Soyck

defendant.name: Soyck, Michael J.
defendant.address: 720 County Road J, Stevens Point, WI

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Statement Regarding Recusal - Molepski, Jr/Judge Finn

Defendant Michael J. Soyck in court with attorney Jerod Barkley. Defendant Michael J. Soyck in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases for plea and sentencing are 14CF-126 and 14CF-228.
Case for sentencing after revocation is 13CF-378.

10:06 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

There is a plea agreement to 14CF-126 and 14CF-228.
State has filed an amended information for 14CF-126, three felony charges have been amended to misdemeanors.
Defendant will plead to all 3 counts.
14CF-228 Dismissed and Read In

Atty Barkley concurs.

With respect to sentence after revocation, Court recevied report from agent.
Both parties received a copy of this report.
There is no reason why Defendant should not be sentenced.

Atty Barkley received a copy of the amended information for 14CF-126 and waives reading.
Court informs Defendant of charges and penalties.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 1 14CF-126
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 2 14CF-126
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 3 14CF-126

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.

Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
14CF-126 Amended Count 1: 943.41(5)(a)
14CF-126 Amended Count 2: 943.41(5)(a)
14CF-126 Amended Count 3: 943.41(5)(a)
14CF-228: Dismissed and Read In

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court to all four cases.
State has been in contact with the victim, is not seeking restitution. State feels jail sentences are appropriate.
Atty Barkley makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Barkley has spoken with victim and was going to be sending a victim impact statement to the DA's office. Atty Barkley requests a time served sentence.
Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court takes a moment to figure out credit, 173 days.

BY THE COURT:
13CF-378:
Count 2:
Jail sentence for 180 days
173 Days credit already served
Sentence is deemed served

13CF-378:
Count 4:
Jail sentence for 180 days concurrent to Count 2
173 Days credit already served
Sentence is deemed served as well

14CF-126:
Count 1:
Jail sentence for 52 days
Huber granted for work and home issues
Pay costs
60 days to pay

14CF-126:
Count 2:
Jail sentence for 52 days concurrent to Count 1
Huber granted for work and home issues
Pay costs
60 days to pay

14CF-126:
Count 3:
Jail sentence for 52 days concurrent to Count 1 and Count 2
Huber granted for work and home issues
Pay costs
60 days to pay
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 2, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on September 15, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 4, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Michael J. Soyck in court with attorney Jerod A Barkley. David R Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea entered.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 4, 2014 at 10:30 am.
for Attorney to Appear and Act
Preliminary hearing on July 7, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Cash bond amended down to this $1,000 sig bond.  Comply with all conditions on 14CF126.  No contact with Cynthia Nieske.

Attorney Jerod A Barkley in court. David R Knaapen with Intern Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.  Case 14CF228 is for initial appearance and 14CF126 following.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties. 
ADA Knaapen informs the court that the DOC has GPS and the State is willing to amend bond to sig bond.
BTC: Cash bond amended down to this $1,000 sig bond with same conditions  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 7, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Court calls case at 1:26 pm.
DA Case #:
ADA Cousins appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Cousins states facts for anticipated charges of Felony Bail Jumping.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court questions the defendant.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
State requests a $2000 cash bond.
No contact with Ms Neiske.
Comply with previous conditions.

BTC:
Cash bond is set at $800
Comply with all conditions on 14CF126.
No contact with Cynthia Nieske.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for: 6-16-14  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 2

Comply with all conditions on 14CF126.
No contact with Cynthia Nieske.
